learning_objectives.description: Understand how text is represented and the use of character sets, including ASCII and Unicode.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Text is converted to binary for processing. Unicode supports a larger range of characters (including languages and emojis) than ASCII. Unicode requires more bits per character.

learning_objectives.description: Understand computer representation of sound, including sample rate and sample resolution.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Sound is sampled and converted to binary. Sample rate is number of samples per second, resolution is the bits per sample. Higher values increase accuracy and file size.

learning_objectives.description: Understand computer representation of images, including resolution and colour depth.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: An image is a grid of pixels stored in binary. Resolution is pixel count; colour depth is bits per pixel. Higher values improve size and quality.
